definition[0]: to arrange to have a job done by a person or company outside your own organization
example[0]: We contracted the catering out to an outside firm.
definition[1]: to agree officially not to take part in something such as a pension plan
definition[2]: to agree officially not to take part in an arrangement
example[1]: If your company uses the state pension scheme and you want to contract out, then you can also have a personal pension.
definition[3]: to arrange to have a job done by a person outside your organization
